intro: Cracca dumetorum, commonly known as field eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Cracca dumetorum is often found in dry meadows and disturbed soils, and it has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
